producers.name: Lovibond, S. H., Lovibond, P. F.

title_statement.title: DASS-21: Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scales
title_statement.subtitle: 21-item self-report measure of negative emotional states

study_info.abstract: The DASS-21 is a 21-item self-report screening instrument that measures three related negative emotional states: depression, anxiety, and stress. It is a shortened version of the 42-item DASS designed to assess these constructs in both clinical and non-clinical populations. Each item is rated on a 4-point scale based on experiences in the past week.

instrument_details.full_name: Depression, Anxiety and Stress Scales - 21 items
instrument_details.response_scale: 4-point Likert (0=Did not apply, 1=Applied some, 2=Applied fairly, 3=Applied very much)
instrument_details.interpretation: Depression: 0-9 Normal, 10-13 Mild, 14-20 Moderate, 21-27 Severe, 28+ Very Severe; Similar for Anxiety and Stress
